FAQ

Have questions? You've come to the right place! Here are all our top questions.

What is a hackathon?

A hackathon is an invention marathon. Students come together to build cool software & hardware hacks over 24-48 hours. It’s very beginner friendly. CuseHacks is not your typical hackathon. We encourage students with any level of experience to sign up.

How much does it cost?

Nothing. Attending a hackathon is free, and we will provide resources throughout the event.

Who can participate?

All current college students are invited to participate.

What if I don't have coding or hackathon experience?

Beginners are especially encouraged to come! You do not need previous hackathon/coding experience or a technology background. CuseHacks is meant to be a comfortable learning experience for everyone. Also, there will be workshops and mentors available throughout the event that can help you get started.

How do teams work?

Each team can have up to as many members as you want. Typically teams run from 3-4 members. You can come with your friends or you can form a team at the event. There will be team forming activities at the beginning of the hackathon for anybody interested. You can also work alone if you want.

Will there be prizes for hacks?

Yes, there are many prizes we will be giving out! At the end of the 24 hours, there will be an expo where you can demo your invention. Judges will be looking for the best inventions to fit the prize categories on the Devpost.

Where is the event?

CuseHacks is going VIRTUAL! Join us from wherever you are in the world. We’ll be hosting it virtually on this website.

Is there a code of conduct?

Yes there is. We enforce it very strongly. You can find it here.

What is Major League Hacking?

Major League Hacking is the official student hackathon league in North America & Europe. They work with over 200 Member Events and empower over 70,000 students every year.

Your question not here?

Please email innovateorange@syr.edu for any more questions.
